activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11642
activity.text:
@yash-learner 

1. While adding the first records itself, button shows up as Add "another" Symptom. Can you fix that?
2. When clicking on a valueset field in mobile, it used to open up the keyboard by default. Now it doesn't
3. When clicking on a text field inside the Add medication drawer, screen auto zooms in. Let's not do that.
4. Medication Request - Duration field is not shown in mobile for PRN. Isn't disabling enough?
5. Medication Request - Titrate dosage values aren't showing up on the collapsed card in mobile
6. "src/components/Medicine/MedicationAdministration/MedicineAdminForm.tsx:
Refactored for better mobile layout with improved spacing" - I see not code change or difference in Admin form other than the unit code 🤔
7. Consultation form - Admission recommended and Follow up advice dont't have same Notes styling

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10969
activity.text:
> ![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/419803759-a5dff327-0054-48fd-9a69-28b6b19a5059.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..b5haXz1KWH8jMlgx2VSXxSnOeKBNSXOkJfsbrqFg4PY)
> 
> * [ ]  A user can access the parent location through breadcrumbs from a child location, even if they only have permission to view the child location.

@nihal467 This is not a bug since the user will be able to see only the child locations they have access to even in the parent's view

activity.text:
> @nihal467 @rithviknishad @amjithtitus09
> 
> * [ ]  In the questionnaire under "Update Encounter," the content is getting clipped in normal review mode.
>   > I couldn't understand the issue clearly. Could you share a screenshot? If it's the first one you shared in the issue, it is outdated issue then.
> * [x]  When the dosage field is completely removed in a medicine request, `0` gets auto-filled, and users are unable to erase it.
> * [ ]  When all symptoms, diagnoses, and allergies are removed, the message shows "No recorded." Update it to "No active available" or provide an option to view removed items, even if none are currently active.
>   > Please confirm the expected behavior, as this requires significant changes based on the final decision.
> * [ ]  Display the recorded time in questionnaires in a human-readable format.
>   > This seems to be caused by broken data. A similar issue was previously assigned to me but was closed as "Not Planned": [Issue #10661](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/issues/10661).
> * [x]  If the encounter class is changed to a non-hospitalization class, any existing hospitalization data should be cleared.

@AdityaJ2305 Why not clear these doubts in the issue itself?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10563
activity.text:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6be2d387-f1f5-45e5-80b0-b003fde34f95)
@AdityaJ2305 Let's try another approach. Create a new generic table that works for all similar to the image. Let's reduce the border thickness and make it gray. The component can take in keys and values in the below format. Column specific styling like labels aren't required.
 
 
```
<
key: [{title:,"allergen", width: x}, {title: "status", width: y}, {title: "criticality", width: x}, ...}]
values: [{allergen: foo1, status: "bar1",...}, {allergen: foo2, status: "bar2",...},...]
/>
```

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10289
activity.text:
@nihal467 Have added the following.
1. Necessary validations for time
2. Prevent scrolling beyond medicine prescription authored timeslots.
3. Fix for notes update
4. Removed discontinue button if already discontinued

**Skipped**
1. Medicine Duplication - Will be fixed when support for multiple dosage instructions is added in Medicine Request 
2. Mobile UI - Working now, will be enhanced later
3. Options to Collapse - Average max would be around 3 per slot (considering once in 2 hours), so skipping it.
4. Administrations not showing up - Cannot be replicated, please recheck if it exists.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10115
activity.text:
@nihal467
1. Medicine Request update seems to be a BE issue. The fix is being pushed. 
2. Removing existing items would mark them as 'Entered in error' in BE along with graying out and disabling the row in FE to prevent further changes.
3. The removed rows would now be hidden by default in the Overview section. Clicking the "view all" would reveal them grayed out.
4. Fixed the date picker format issue in the form. The format displayed in the Overview is dd/mm/yyyy for me.
